dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Global stock markets just pulled back from their strong start to the year, with the S&P 500 down almost 0.7% on Friday's news.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Global stock markets just pulled back from their strong start to the year, with the S&P five hundred down almost zero point seven percent on Friday's news.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stock markets pulled back from their strong start to the new year and oil prices surged on Friday, following an overnight U.S. airstrike that killed Irans most senior general and significantly inflamed tensions in the Middle East. U.S. stocks plunged on Friday following the news, with the S&P 500 down almost 0.7% and the Dow down nearly 250 points, or 0.8%, in morning trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that was all triggered by the U.S. airstrike that killed Iran's top general, Qassem Soleimani, at Baghdad International Airport.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that was all triggered by the U.S. airstrike that killed Iran's top general, Qassem Soleimani, at Baghdad International Airport.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Major General Qassem Soleimani, one of Irans top military leaders, was killed in a drone strike at Baghdad International Airport on Thursday night, the Pentagon confirmed, sparking strong condemnations from the Iranian governmentwho vowed to retaliate for the action.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and oil prices surged more than 4% immediately after, hitting an eight-month high of almost $70 a barrel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and oil prices surged more than four percent immediately after, hitting an eight-month high of almost seventy dollars a barrel.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While stocks retreated from their early 2020 rally, oil prices surged more than 4%, hitting an 8-month high of almost $70 per barrel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense, because analysts are worried Iran might retaliate by attacking oil infrastructure in places like Saudi Arabia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense, because analysts are worried Iran might retaliate by attacking oil infrastructure in places like Saudi Arabia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Analysts are concerned that the U.S. airstrikes will lead Iran to retaliate by attacking oil infrastructure of U.S. allies in the Middle East, like Saudi Arabia, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—that kind of move would seriously disrupt global supply chains and send prices even higher.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-that kind of move would seriously disrupt global supply chains and send prices even higher.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such a retaliation would disrupt global oil supply chains and likely also send the prices oil skyrocketing further.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it wasn't just U.S. markets; the Stoxx Europe 600 fell 0.4%, Hong Kong's Hang Seng dropped 0.5%...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it wasn't just U.S. markets; the Stoxx Europe six hundred fell zero point four percent, Hong Kong's Hang Seng dropped zero point five percent...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The escalating tensions between the U.S. and Iran also weighed on other global stock markets: The Stoxx Europe 600 fell by 0.4% and Hong Kongs Hang Seng index was down 0.3%, for example.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So it really had a worldwide ripple effect. But you know, Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge pointed out something interesting—he said this is different from other geopolitical shocks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it really had a worldwide ripple effect. But you know, Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge pointed out something interesting-he said this is different from other geopolitical shocks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the markets usual knee-jerk reactions to geopolitical shocks tend to fade, this particular development is different than the others, Adam Crisafulli, founder of Vital Knowledge, said in a note on Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Because striking Soleimani is arguably the most consequential decision Trump has made so far?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because striking Soleimani is arguably the most consequential decision Trump has made so far?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Striking Soleimani is the most consequential decision made by Trump thus far, while the S&P 500s high valuation multiple doesnt leave it with much capacity to absorb bad news.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he added that the S&P's high valuation doesn't leave much room to absorb bad news like this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he added that the S&P's high valuation doesn't leave much room to absorb bad news like this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Striking Soleimani is the most consequential decision made by Trump thus far, while the S&P 500s high valuation multiple doesnt leave it with much capacity to absorb bad news.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's definitely escalating tensions at a fragile time. The foreign minister of Iran called it an "extremely dangerous and foolish escalation."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's definitely escalating tensions at a fragile time. The foreign minister of Iran called it an extremely dangerous and foolish escalation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Iran harshly condemned the airstrikes and vowed to retaliate: Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif said on Twitter that the U.S. bears responsibility for what he called an extremely dangerous and foolish escalation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And now the U.S. embassy is telling all American citizens to leave Iraq immediately. That's uh, not a small warning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now the U.S. embassy is telling all American citizens to leave Iraq immediately. That's uh, not a small warning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid the promises of Iranian retaliation, the U.S. embassy issued a security alert on Friday urging all American citizens to depart Iraq immediately.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's not. Markets hate uncertainty, and this situation is just drenched in it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's not. Markets hate uncertainty, and this situation is just drenched in it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. We'll have to see how things develop over the weekend—retaliation threats don't usually fade quickly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. We'll have to see how things develop over the weekend-retaliation threats don't usually fade quickly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Especially when oil is already reacting this strongly. Investors are gonna be watching every headline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially when oil is already reacting this strongly. Investors are gonna be watching every headline.
